text: , sometimes credited as , is a Japanese animation studio founded on December 13, 1979, by former Mushi Pro members. ==Works== ===Television series=== ===1980s=== *Touch (Fuji TV) (March, 1985 – March, 1987) (production assistance; animated by Group TAC) *High School! Kimengumi (Fuji TV) (October, 1985 – September, 1987) (production assistance; animated by Studio Comet) *The Three Musketeers Anime (NHK BS2) (October, 1987 – February, 1989) (animation cooperation with Sei Young Animation) *Kiteretsu Daihyakka (Fuji TV) (March, 1988 – June, 1996) *Miracle Giants Dome-kun (Nippon TV) (April, 1989 – March, 1990) *Gaki Deka (Fuji TV) (October, 1989 – March , 1990) ===1990s=== *Tanken Gobrin Shima (NHK BS2) (April, 1990 – March, 1991) *RPG Densetsu Hepoi (TV Tokyo) (October, 1990 – September, 1991) *Genji Tsūshin Agedama (TV Tokyo) (October, 1991 – September, 1992) *Chikyū SOS Soreike Kororin (NHK BS2) (April, 1992 – March, 1993) *Hime-chan's Ribbon (TV Tokyo) (October, 1992 – December, 1993) *Dragon League (Fuji TV) (May, 1993 – February, 1994) *Akazukin Chacha (TV Tokyo) (January, 1994 – June, 1995) *Nurse Angel Ririka SOS (TV Tokyo) (July, 1995 – March, 1996) *Rurouni Kenshin (Fuji TV) (January, 1996 –November, 1997) (first 66 episodes; later animated by Studio Deen) *Kodomo no Omocha (TV Tokyo) (April, 1996 – March, 1998) *Kochira Katsushika- ku Kameari Kōen-mae Hashutsujo (Fuji TV) (June, 1996 – December, 2004 special broadcast: 2005–2008; last special episode: 2016) *Initial D (Fuji TV) (April, 1998 – November, 1998) (animation cooperation with Studio Comet) *Ojarumaru (NHK E) (October, 1998 – present) ===2000s=== *Transformers: Car Robots (TV Tokyo) (April, 2000 – December, 2000) *Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters (TXN/TV Tokyo) (April, 2000 – September, 2004) *Bakuten Shoot Bayblade (TXN/TV Tokyo) (January, 2001 – December, 2003) (production assistance; animated by Madhouse and Nippon Animation) *Forza! Hidemaru (TV Tokyo) (April, 2002 – September, 2002) *Bomberman Jetters (TV Tokyo) (October, 2002 – September, 2003) *Astro Boy 2003 (Fuji TV) (April, 2003 – March, 2004) (production assistance; animated by Tezuka Productions) *Legendz Yomigaeru Ryūō Densetsu (Fuji TV) (April, 2004 – March, 2005) *Morizo to Kikkoro (NHK BS2) (April, 2004 –July, 2005) *Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters GX (TXN/TV Tokyo) (October, 2004 – March, 2008) *Animal Yokochō (TV Tokyo) (October, 2005 – September, 2006) *Eyeshield 21 (TV Tokyo) (April, 2005 – March, 2008) *Hataraki Man (Fuji TV) (October, 2006 – December, 2006) *Yasashi Sato Kandō no kodama (BS Fuji) (April, 2007 – March, 2008) *Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's (TXN/TV Tokyo) (April, 2008 – March, 2011) *Mainichi Kaasan (TV Tokyo) (April, 2009 – March, 2012) ===2010s=== *Yu-Gi-Oh! Arc-V (TXN/TV Tokyo) (April, 2014 – March, 2017) *World Trigger (TV Asahi) (October, 2014 – April, 2016) (production assistance; animated by Toei Animation) *Jewelpet: Magical Chance (TVO/TV Tokyo) (April, 2015 – December, 2015) (animation cooperation with Studio DEEN) *Yu-Gi-Oh! VRAINS (TXN/TV Tokyo) (May, 2017 – September, 2019) *Cardcaptor Sakura: Clear Card (NHK BS2) (January, 2018 – June, 2018) (animation cooperation with Madhouse) *Bakutsuri Bar Hunter (TV Tokyo) (October, 2018 – March, 2019) (animation cooperation with Toei Animation) ===2020s=== *Digimon Adventure: (Fuji TV) (April, 2020 – September, 2021) (production assistance; animated by Toei Animation) *Digimon Ghost Game (Fuji TV) (October, 2021 – March, 2023) (production assistance; animated by Toei Animation) *Fushigi dagashiya: Zenitendō - Tsuri taiyaki (NHK E) (April, 2022 – present) (animation cooperation with Toei Animation; episode 53 onwards) *Me & Roboco (TV Tokyo) (December, 2022 – June, 2023) *Kagaku Manga Survival (NHK BS2) (October, 2024 - present ) ===Original video animations=== *Prefectural Earth Defense Force (1986) *Mugen Shinshi Bōken Katsugeki-hen (1987) *Maps: Densetsu no Samayoeru Seijintachi (1987) *TWD Express: Rolling Takeoff (1987) *To-y (1987) *One Pound Gospel (1988) *Fujiko F.
